abstract: Wal-Mart and the Service Employees International Union are said to have agreed on a series of goals for achieving universal health coverage.
snippet: Wal-Mart and the Service Employees International Union are said to have agreed on a series of goals for achieving universal health coverage.
lead_paragraph: They have established one of the fiercest rivalries in the American economy, attacking one another’s organizations through dueling blogs, newspaper advertisements and news conferences.

headline.main: Wal-Mart and a Union Unite, at Least on Health Policy

byline.original: By Michael Barbaro and Robert Pear
